db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Represents a handle to a signal-slot (or signal-functor) connection.

It can be used to check if the connection is valid and to disconnect it using QObject::disconnect(). For a signal-functor connection without a context object, it is the only way to selectively disconnect that connection.
As Connection is just a handle, the underlying signal-slot connection is unaffected when Connection is destroyed or reassigned.

db:section.db:title: Connection::Connection(const QMetaObject::Connection &other)
db:section.db:para: Create a copy of the handle to the other connection

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] Connection::Connection(QMetaObject::Connection &&o)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a Connection instance, making it point to the same object that o was pointing to.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void Connection::swap(QMetaObject::Connection &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps this Connection instance with other. This operation is very fast and never fails.

db:section.db:title: bool Connection::operator bool() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the connection is valid.
The connection is valid if the call to QObject::connect succeeded. The connection is invalid if QObject::connect was not able to find the signal or the slot, or if the arguments do not match.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QMetaObject::Connection &Connection::operator=(QMetaObject::Connection &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-assigns other to this object, and returns a reference.

db:section.db:title: QMetaObject::Connection &Connection::operator=(const QMetaObject::Connection &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns other to this connection and returns a reference to this connection.
